intro: Sidalcea neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sidalcea neomexicana is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
